summary: MOC (Memorandum of Oral Commitment) Amendments pertain to modifications of agreements, specifically regarding individuals working with JMWAVE. These amendments typically involve adjustments to salary, funding mechanisms, and tax obligations. The documents highlight changes in compensation, such as salary increases due to dependents, and alterations in how individuals are paid, including shifting from covert income tax arrangements to direct payroll with tax deductions. These amendments reflect the operational adjustments and financial management related to specific individuals (subjects) involved in covert activities.
significance: While the documents do not explicitly link MOC Amendments to the JFK assassination, they reveal operational details and financial arrangements related to individuals possibly involved in covert activities during the same period. The amendments highlight the financial and logistical aspects of managing individuals within the intelligence apparatus, which could be relevant in understanding the broader context of operations during the JFK era.
